bbc.title: Takeaways from the millions of newly released Epstein files
bbc.description: Three million new documents include hundreds of mentions of Trump and emails between Epstein and a person called "The Duke".

bbc.title: Rape trial puts Norway's royal family in unwelcome glare of public
bbc.description: Marius Borg Høiby, the crown prince's blond stepson, is accused of 38 charges in a case that has attracted global interest.

bbc.title: Deadly gun and bomb attacks hit Pakistan's Balochistan province
bbc.description: The Pakistani military says 31 civilians and 17 security forces were killed and its response killed 145 attackers.

bbc.title: Slovakia PM's national security adviser resigns over Epstein links
bbc.description: Miroslav Lajčák steps down after newly released exchanges showed him discussing girls and diplomacy with the late sex offender.

bbc.title: LA 2028 Olympics chief 'deeply regrets' flirty emails with Ghislaine Maxwell
bbc.description: Casey Wasserman's flirty emails were among millions of files published by the US Department of Justice on Friday.

bbc.title: Israeli air strikes kill at least 32 Palestinians in Gaza, rescue officials say
bbc.description: Israel's military confirmed the strikes, which come during a ceasefire that Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaking.

bbc.title: Grammy Awards 2026: How to watch and who will win
bbc.description: Who's performing, who will win, and everything else you need to know about the 2026 Grammy ceremony.

bbc.title: Five killed in gas explosions in Iran, officials say
bbc.description: Fourteen people are reportedly injured after separate blasts were reported on Saturday.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: OPEC+ on Track to Ratify March Output Pause, Delegates Say
bloomberg.description: OPEC+ is close to ratifying plans to pause production increases in March, delegates said ahead of the group’s online meeting on Sunday.

bloomberg.title: Saudi Oil-Supply Hikes Power Best Economic Growth Since 2022
bloomberg.description: Saudi Arabia’s economy expanded at the fastest pace in three years in 2025, with the oil sector emerging as a stronger engine of growth under new OPEC+ supply policy.

bloomberg.title: India’s Plan to Hike Tax on Equity Derivatives Jolts Market
bloomberg.description: Indian equities slumped after the government said it plans to raise taxes on equity derivatives trades, doubling down on efforts to curb speculative activity among retail investors.

bloomberg.title: NCC Said in Talks to Sell Industry Unit to CRH-Heidelberg Group
bloomberg.description: Nordic construction firm NCC AB is in advanced talks to sell its industry business to a consortium including CRH Plc and Heidelberg Materials AG, two of the world’s biggest building materials companie

bloomberg.title: India Balances Growth, Budget Discipline as Global Risks Mount
bloomberg.description: India’s finance minister unveiled a relatively cautious budget on Sunday, focusing on economic stability in the face of rising global risks.

bloomberg.title: India to Double Tax Holiday in Finance Hub to Boost Business
bloomberg.description: India will extend a tax holiday at its international finance hub to boost the appeal for businesses setting up shop there.

bloomberg.title: India Seeks Diaspora Capital as Foreign Funds Pull Out of Local Stocks
bloomberg.description: India is seeking to draw more money from its overseas nationals into local equities as global funds pull back amid concerns over corporate earnings and more attractive returns elsewhere.

bloomberg.title: India’s Record $187 Billion Debt Sales Add Pressure to Bonds
bloomberg.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government plans to sell a record amount of bonds in the coming fiscal year, a move that risks adding further pressure to local debt markets amid waning demand.

bloomberg.title: Zelenskiy Says Next Trilateral Peace Talks to Be Feb. 4-5
bloomberg.description: The next trilateral meetings between the US, Russia and Ukraine will be held Feb. 4-5 in Abu Dhabi, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

bloomberg.title: India Ramps Up Infrastructure Spending in $130 Billion Budget Push

bloomberg.title: URGENT: Democrat Taylor Rehmet wins a reliably Republican Texas state Senate seat, stunning GOP
bloomberg.description: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.

bloomberg.title: The Druckenmiller Effect: Famed Investor Has Ties to Bessent, Warsh
bloomberg.description: Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director Erik Schatzker explains why Stanley Druckenmiller of the Duquesne Family Office may soon see his market principles permeate both US fiscal and monetary policy.

bloomberg.title: Nuevo Leon's Garcia on Trade, Data Centers and Mexico's Presidency
bloomberg.description: Nuevo Leon Governor Samuel Garcia discusses how his state is positioning itself as a key technology and data hub in Latin America, as well as his aspirations to reach Mexico's highest political office

bloomberg.title: Trump Says He Welcomes China, India Investment in Venezuela Oil
